meanings.definition: Determine the limits or boundaries of something.
meanings.sent1: I will delimit the area for the new playground with colorful flags.
meanings.sent2: The surveyor needs to delimit the property lines before construction can begin.
meanings.sent3: Trying to delimit where the sidewalk ends and the grass begins can be tricky.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to delimit the joy in the room, spreading warmth to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The fence acts as a physical barrier to delimit the garden from the rest of the yard.

meanings.definition: Set or establish the limits or boundaries of something.
meanings.sent1: The rules will delimit the time allowed for each presentation.
meanings.sent2: It is important to delimit the scope of the project to avoid confusion.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to delimit the ingredients for the recipe but ended up using a bit of everything.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed seemed to delimit any obstacles in his path.
meanings.sent5: The sign was placed strategically to delimit the parking area for visitors.
